modules.description: Computes SHA256 digests of strings and verifies RSA-PSS signatures using a provided key. Operates on string inputs and returns results with explicit error handling. Used to validate signed data against a public key in cryptographic workflows.

Computes cryptographic digests from strings and wire-encoded data, and verifies signatures against a set of keys and signatures. Operates on string inputs, wire-encoded structures, and cryptographic keys and signatures. Used to validate data integrity and authenticity in secure communication protocols.

Provides functions to decode and generate RSA keys, extract metadata like creation timestamp and identifier, compute key size, derive public keys from private ones, and sign data using PSS. Operates on a private key type `t` and related cryptographic data. Used to manage RSA key pairs, verify signatures, and handle cryptographic operations with specific encoding requirements.

Provides cryptographic verification of package integrity and authenticity using RSA-PSS-SHA256 signatures, validates signed checksums and build instructions, and enforces quorum-based signing for package-key relationships. Operates on signed metadata, cryptographic keys, and package manifests. Used to ensure trusted package distribution in opam repositories by verifying signatures from authorized maintainers and root keys.

Computes and verifies cryptographic hashes and signatures, handling both string and wire-encoded data. Supports RSA-PSS signing and verification, key management, and metadata extraction from RSA keys. Functions operate on private keys, public keys, and signed data, enabling secure authentication and data integrity checks. Examples include generating RSA key pairs, signing messages with PSS, and validating signatures against public keys.
